name: 4-7-8 Breathing (Sleep Aid)
description: Dr. Andrew Weil's relaxation breathing technique. Powerful sleep aid and anxiety reducer. Inhale 4, hold 7, exhale 8.

exercises.name: 4-7-8 Basic (4 cycles)
exercises.description: Entry dose - perfect before bed or for acute anxiety
exercises.instructions: Tongue on roof of mouth behind teeth. Inhale through nose counting 4. Hold counting 7. Exhale through mouth (whoosh sound) counting 8. Repeat 4 times.
exercises.bestUsedFor: Sleep onset, panic attacks, pre-sleep routine, acute stress
exercises.scienceBacked: Extended exhale activates parasympathetic system, clinically proven for anxiety

exercises.name: 4-7-8 Extended (8 cycles)
exercises.instructions: Same technique, 8 complete cycles. Expect to feel very relaxed or sleepy by the end.
exercises.bestUsedFor: Severe insomnia, high anxiety, post-workout wind-down
exercises.caution: May feel lightheaded - normal. If uncomfortable, return to 4 cycles.

exercises.name: 4-7-8 Bedtime Routine
exercises.description: Combined with body awareness for deep sleep preparation
exercises.instructions: In bed, lights off. 4 cycles of 4-7-8 breathing. Then body scan from toes to head. Repeat 4-7-8 if still awake.
exercises.bestUsedFor: Nightly sleep routine, chronic insomnia support
exercises.combinedBenefit: Breathing calms nervous system, body scan releases physical tension

exercises.name: 4-7-8 Anxiety Break (Quick)
exercises.instructions: Can be done anywhere. Just 2 cycles of 4-7-8. Quick reset button for anxiety spikes.
exercises.bestUsedFor: Meeting anxiety, social situations, unexpected stress
exercises.discrete: Can be done sitting at desk, in car, before presentations
